revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: col. i and, intending to send a couch and cushion to the temple, I was prevented by Techosis... �and, being assaulted with humiliating blows�. We fought off Ptolemaios the clerk on behalf of (my) slave-boy... �I stopped opposing him and fighting a[nd]�it is not just until you are on hand so that the details can be worked out through you. And I swear by all gods and even the genius of the king: unless you quickly come here to settle (this), you will not see me in Krokodeilon (Polis). For it is handsomely beneficial for Ptolemaios to be brought upright away by (hypo) the 6 such that you do not stay. [[...and opportunely again the gods...]] �know... if�to arrive at peace�god... Be well. Year 28, Pauni 18

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., III.765; C. Ptol. Sklav., no. 245. On lines 13 and 14, see BL v. 9, p. 358.
